intro: Pycnophyllum spathulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
